newsitem.title: CZECH REPUBLIC: SKODA SIGNS DEAL WITH NAVISTAR.
newsitem.headline: SKODA SIGNS DEAL WITH NAVISTAR.

text.p: Czech engineering concern Skoda a.s. on Tuesday said it had signed an agreement with U.S.-based Navistar Transportation Corp on the production and sales of mid-sized trucks.
"The cooperation will be in the production and sales of mid-sized trucks in central and eastern Europe where there are long-term business opportunities," a Skoda statement said.
The statement added that the central European production base could be used to supply the vehicles to other European and Asian markets.
Skoda will produce the trucks through its subsidiary Skoda Liaz, a truckmaker, while Navistar is expected to supply engine technology.
Last year Navistar built some 80,000 trucks and 220,000 engines.
Before 1990, Liaz produced up to 20,000 trucks a year but last year it produced only 1,000 vehicles after sales to its former Soviet Bloc market collapsed.
